summary.span: 描述用於儲存成員資格使用者密碼的加密格式。

span.span: Describes the encryption format for storing passwords for membership users.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別支援不同的密碼儲存格式，但是您應該只使用`Hashed`;`Clear`和`Encrypted`並未受到保護。The class supports different password storage formats but you should only use `Hashed`; `Clear` and `Encrypted` are not secure. 清除密碼不安全，且不應使用。Clear passwords are not secure and shouldn't be used. 它們會以純文字格式儲存。They are stored in plain text. 加密的密碼不安全的因為的缺口都可顯示您的資料庫內容，也可以公開加密金鑰。Encrypted passwords are not considered safe, as a breach that reveals your database contents can also expose the encryption key. 這表示可以解密加密的密碼，並且公開。This means your encrypted passwords could be decrypted and exposed. 密碼可予以解密以便比較或擷取密碼在儲存時加密。Passwords are encrypted when stored and can be decrypted for password comparison or password retrieval. 使用單向 salt 雜湊儲存在資料庫中加密雜湊的密碼。Hashed passwords are encrypted using a one-way salted hash when stored in the database. 驗證密碼時，它是結合的 salt 值，然後進行雜湊。When a password is validated, it is combined with a salt value and then hashed. 與驗證資料庫中的值進行比較的結果。The result is compared with the value in the database for verification. 無法擷取雜湊的密碼。Hashed passwords cannot be retrieved. > [!NOTE] > 如果您不熟悉的 ASP.NET 成員資格功能，請參閱[成員資格簡介](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980)才能繼續。If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/79184d17-f4c7-4c9f-a073-cec4f5543980) before continuing. 如需與成員資格相關的其他主題的清單，請參閱[使用成員資格管理使用者](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd)。For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/824c3a24-f0af-427c-a652-0d2d1e9397cd). ## Examples 下列範例示範中的項目`system.web`的 ASP.NET 應用程式的 Web.config 檔案區段。The following example shows the element in the `system.web` section of the Web.config file for an ASP.NET application. 它會指定應用程式的執行個體，並將其密碼格式設定為`Hashed`。It specifies the application's instance and sets its password format to `Hashed`. ``` ```
